quizzes.title: History Quiz: Indiana Beach and Roller
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, judge, roller. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is Judge Dredds first name?

options.text: None of these, nobody knows his first name

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph

questions.question: There has never been a wooden roller coaster with an inversion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the first modern roller coaster to have a vertical loop?

options.text: Shockwave, Six Flags Great America, Gurnee, Illinois, United  states
Dragon Khan, Port Aventura, Salou, Spain
Revolution, Six Flags Magic Mountain, Valencia, California
Corkscrew, Knotts Berry Farm, Buena Park, California

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Revolution, Six Flags Magic Mountain, Valencia, California

questions.question: What year did Indiana Beach open?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1926

questions.question: What type of walk-through attraction at Indiana Beach was voted the worlds #1 in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a haunted house

questions.question: In addition to the sandy beach, Indiana Beach also has a large waterpark.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Judge Dredd is 2000 ADs longest-running character, appearing from the first issue in 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Judge Dredds visual appearance was loosely based on the character of Frankenstein from the film Death Race 2000.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following is not a lodging option at Indiana Beach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Time-shares

questions.question: The giant city, Mega City One, where Judge Dredd is a lawkeeper, is located in which area that we would recognise nowadays?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East coast USA

questions.question: Which roller coaster was Indiana Beachs first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galaxy

questions.question: What is the Shafer Queen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: River boat

questions.question: What is the Indiana Beach slogan?

options.text: A beach in the middle of nowhere
A beach in the middle of a corn field
Come and walk on the boardwalk!
Theres more than corn in Indiana.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theres more than corn in Indiana.

questions.question: Who is the mascot for Indiana Beach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: IB Crow

questions.question: Indiana Beach has a water and ski show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Character and Homestar Runner
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, judge, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Cartoon character Strong Bad got this name because he can bench-press 125 pounds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Homestar Runner, what power does the blue diamond on Strong Bads mask give him?

options.text: He can hover about three inches off the ground.
He can make a black dot appear on walls.
He can mentally open Cold Ones.
He can change the color of his mask at any time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He can mentally open Cold Ones.

questions.question: In the e-mail animal, Homestar Runner character Strong Bad is asked to make-up an animal. What is NOT one of the animals that he creates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Mongo

questions.question: Fictional character Batman has a son.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What sentence does Judge Dredd frequently utter during his duties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I am the law!

questions.question: Judge Dredd once lived in an apartment block named after a character from Rawhide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of the fan club dedicated to Homestar Runner character Strong Bad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Deleteheads

questions.question: In the Homestar Runner cartoon, Strong Bad and Strong Sad co-author the Teen Girl Squad comic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the e-mail secret recipes, Strong Bad claims he has a secret family recipe for cooking which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chekt

questions.question: What was the name of Judge Dredds clone-brother, who he turned in to the authorities when he began to break the law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rico

questions.question: In the Internet cartoon Homestar Runner, Strong Bad works with Homestar and The Cheat at an unnamed tech company, but what is his dream job?

options.text: universal make-out helper for hot girls
supreme ultralord of the international gazebo

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2nd 2nd assistant space whale scrubber

questions.question: Which of the following has Judge Dredd not battled against?

options.text: Daleks from the TV series Dr Who

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daleks from the TV series Dr Who

questions.question: In the film Judge Dredd, who plays the title character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sylvester Stallone

questions.question: In The New Batman Adventures episode Over the Edge, who does Commissioner Gordon hire to help him kill Batman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bane

questions.question: What issue did the Joker originally appear in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detective Comics #168

options.text: Come on, comrades! Up to the rooftop! Go!
Get that flag up! Berlin is ours!

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Emmett Kelly and Year
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, cecil, america. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Circus performer Emmet Kelly is depicted in a famous photograph trying to put out the fire that occurred shortly after the San Francisco Earthquake in 1938.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1957, Cecil B. DeMilles hired Emmett Kelly to perform in I, Clowns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: During the talent portion of the Miss America competition the contestants perform on stage. What are the two most common talents that are exhibited?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Singing and dancing

questions.question: Emmett Kellys character, Weary Willie, always made fans burst out in laughter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where did the first Miss America pageant take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlantic City, New Jersey

questions.question: Emmett Kelly, who initially was a trapeze artist, started working as a clown in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1931

questions.question: What was the name of Emmett Kellys son, who also played a character named Weary Willie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emmett Kelly Jr.

questions.question: The Miss America Pageant is the number one provider of which of the following?

options.text: Medical insurance for women in the United States
Job opportunities for women in the United States
Scholarships for women in the United States

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scholarships for women in the United States

questions.question: How many years does the winner of the Miss America Pageant hold the Miss America title?

options.text: She is Miss America for the rest of her life.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: How many contestants are there in the Miss America competition each year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 52

questions.question: Emmett Kelly died of heart attack in 1979 at age of 80.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Emmett Kelly took a year off from the stage and circus to serve as mascot for which baseball team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooklyn Dodgers

questions.question: Choose the missing words in the following lyrics to get the name of a song from Guitar Hero 3:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mississippi queen

questions.question: Name Emmett Kellys birth state, which is also the location of the Emmett Kelly Museum.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kansas

questions.question: Circus performer Emmet Kelly started his trapeze act in 1923 with the John Robinson Circus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
